sub_topic: Prove that the Cartesian product of two sets is not associative with respect to symmetric difference.
message_1:
Let A = {2, 3, 4} and B = {1, 2}. 
Calculate (A × B) △ A and A △ (B × A), where △ denotes the symmetric difference. Show that the result is not the same, hence proving that the Cartesian product of two sets is not associative with respect to symmetric difference.
